conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the electrostatic force on point charge q between capacitor plates.
Electric field E between plates is E = Q / (ε₀ A).
Capacitance C of a parallel-plate capacitor is C = ε₀ A / d.
Rearrange capacitance equation to ε₀ A = C d.
Substitute ε₀ A = C d into electric field equation to get E = Q / (C d).
Force F on charge q is F = qE, substitute E to get F = q(Q / C d).
Final answer: Magnitude of electrostatic force is F = qQ / C d.
